column2: Which language do you want to take the questionaire in? En quelle langue voulez-vous faire le questionnaire?
column3: Have you ever participated in a permaculture project? (can be your own garden, or a community project)
column4: Avez-vous déjà participé à un projet de permaculture? (votre propre jardin ou un projet collectif par exemple)
column5: How long have you done permaculture?
column6: How long did you/ do you usually take to design your garden?
column7: Would you be interested in an app or website that could help you design a permaculture garden?
column8: What are the functionalities you would find useful in an app or website that could help you design a permaculture garden? (please be as extensive as possible)
column9: Depuis combien de temps faites-vous de la permaculture/ Combien de temps avez-vous fait de la permaculture?
column10: Combien de temps avez-vous pris/ prenez-vous habituellement pour designer votre jardin
column11: Seriez-vous interessé.e par une app ou un site web vous aidant à designer votre jardin en permaculture?
column12: Quelles fonctionnalités trouveriez-vous utiles dans une app ou un site web pour vous aider à designer votre jardin en permaculture? (soyez aussi complet que possible svp)
column14: Planting suggestions according to the app/website visit's date
column15: Possibility to save a garden profile (which plants you already have, their layout, and other parameters)
column16: Possibility to share your garden profile and look for already made ones
column17: Possibility to share on other social media
column19: Possibility to chat with other people
column22: Fertilisation tips (compost tea, natural fertilisers, etc)
column23: Do you measure anything in your garden (temperature, soil composition, sun exposure, humidity, etc)? If yes, what are the parameters you measure?
column24: If you answered yes to the previous question, would you find it useful to integrate your own mesurements to the design tool?
column25: If there was one and only one functionality you would add on that tool that wasn't mentioned, what would it be?
column26: Choix du type de jardin (ornemental, potager, régénération du sol)
column27: Suggestions de plantations en fonction de la date de visite de l'app/ du site
column28: Possibilité de sauvegarder un profil de jardin (quelles plantes vous avez déjà, leur disposition et autres paramètres)
column29: Possibilité de partager votre profil de jardin et d'en chercher de déjà faits
column30: Possibiltié de partager sur d'autres réseaux sociaux
column32: Possibilité de discuter avec d'autres personnes
column35: Tips de fertilisation (thé de compost, fertilisants naturels, etc)
column36: Est-ce que vous mesurez quelque chose dans votre jardin (température, composition du sol, exposition au soleil, humidité, etc)? Si oui, quels paramètres mesurez-vous?
column37: Si vous avez répondu oui à la question précédente, trouveriez-vous utile de pouvoir intégrer vos propres mesures à l'outil développé?
column38: S'il devait y avoir une et une seule fonctionnalité à ajouter qui n'a pas été mentionnée, quelle serait-elle?

column8: Plant database with lots of info for each plant (size, growing/native zone/region/climate, uses, guild roles, forest layer etc). A food forest/guild designer to help fill in all the roles & functions. Hooks in to local and/or online nurseries to help buy plants. 3D modeling of property and assets (adding plants of buildings). Collected regional data (watershed, elevation, seasonal temperature ranges, precipitation, frost dates...). Flow simulator for earthworks and water movement.

column8: Whatever It is needs to have a calendar function that shows things like time to plant time to do other things also have something show like what mushrooms are in season in your particular area

You should be able to plan multiple guilds, maybe in different folders. Each guild should have slots for different sections (understory, canopy, etc.). Maybe the app could suggest plants that pair well with plants you have already added to your guild, or show a table of the roles plants in your guild play so that you can fill in missing gaps. There should also be a way to map the layout of your project, with the ability to place plants from a birds eye view (for ease of planting) and a head on view (to assess composition and ensure adequate access to light).

Sun and space requirements

column8:
1. Intuitive Input of Layout, drawing lines and having the measurements be on the side of the lines would go along way. Extra points for angles between adjacent lines, people can roughly estimate this so could be good to have.
2. Have a list of more commonly used trees and plants with average sizes, this could be referenced with super simple stylised drag and drop sort of icons that you would place on the map.
3. It depends how far you want to go but you could include directional sunlight and then have alerts showing that specific things need more sun or less sun. And show shade of the larger fauna.
4. Maybe included a chicken coop?
5. My advice is make this a website first. Then maybe an app. Just in my experience with software I’d advise that. Maybe even don’t bother with an app?
6. Allow for section of community inputs with the icons/specific fauna and it’s related stats. (Could include an approval process with community voting?)
7. Super sleek UI.
If you still have questions reach out to me, I’d be happy to help with conceptualising but as it’s a college project, the code itself should reeeaaallly be done by just you. After it’s finished though we can probably get it to the point where we host it and allow it to be used by lots of people, I’d imagine it would be well-received.
Drag and drop legend items, integration with plant database, compilation of climate data based on location

column8: Contour map generator (like contourmapgenerator.com), Shade/shadow calculator to map shadows that buildings cast that affect planting suitability (kind of like shadowcalculator.eu, but that one seems off and doesn't work well), landscape design features for planting layouts (I haven't found a good app for this - they're all either too basic or too difficult to use).
Diagram capabilities? Not sure
Weather and crops good for space

I would like a way to map the daylight hours across my garden, as well as the microclimates (if I could also map the areas with most-least wind, and note the date that different beds' soil gets about X temperature). I would also like to be able to draw where hoses reach, zones that I can get to (ie, where needy plants should go vs. where is the most difficult to get to). Basically, I am a very visual person and don't have the skill myself to draw these maps by hand but need to see how these overlay.
